title: How to Do the Barrel Roll Easter Egg on Google & Chromebook

steps.title: Type https://www.google.com into a web browser on your computer.
steps.content: Type https://www.google.com into a web browser on your computer. You’ll need to use Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge, or Firefox on a computer to see the barrel roll.

steps.title: Type do a barrel roll into the search bar.
steps.content: Type do a barrel roll into the search bar. It’s at the top of the page.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . The Google website will now rotate inside your browser. If you don’t see the barrel roll, you may have disabled animations in your browser settings. You may also be using a browser add-on/extension that prevents CSS animations from loading. [1] X Research source Temporarily disabling add-ons that change the way websites appear (such as Stylish, Stylus, or various extensions that aim to speed up your browser) may solve the issue. [2] X Research source You can also do a barrel roll by typing the text Z or R twice into the search bar and pressing ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . Another way to do a barrel roll is to point your browser directly to https://elgoog.im/doabarrelroll . The page may take a few seconds to load and rotate. For another Easter egg that makes the search page look different, try searching for askew . This tilts the page so it looks slightly off-center.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Alt+⇧ Shift+Rotate.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Alt + ⇧ Shift + Rotate . The rotate key is located above the number keys and has an image of a rotating arrow. It should be above the 4 key (but may vary depending on your Chromebook model). [3] X Research source Once you press these keys, the currently open screen will rotate.
